author: Jeremy Chunn
title: AMP, TAL and AIA win Blue Ribbon Awards for the best insurance products of 2015
text:
by Jeremy Chunn The best policies strike a balance between cost and benefits if illness or injury strikes.
BEST TRAUMA POLICY WINNER: AMP Flexible Lifetime Protection Trauma Optimum
What the Rice Warner judges said: "AMP's policy offers an excellent balance of features and prices all covered by a strong financial strength rating."
Age brings wisdom but also an increase in the probability of heart conditions, cancer and stroke. Serious conditions such as those just do not pop into the consciousness of young, healthy consumers who are planning their finances and risk cover, but they should.
"When people experience a traumatic medical event – such as a cancer diagnosis or heart attack – there is often a long road to recovery and restoration of health," says Megan Beer, AMP's acting group executive, insurance and superannuation.
Research shows continuing to work has significant benefits while in recovery, Beer says, pointing out that trauma insurance is suitable for people with significant debts and dependencies. "When the unexpected happens, trauma insurance provides the much needed funds to assist not only in recovery, but also provides funds to secure the long-term security of a family affected by illness."
While many insured will make a full recovery, some may find their ability to earn has been curtailed, she says, and the right cover can provide a lump sum for future outgoings. Critically for the judges, AMP's policy delivers smart cover that adequately compensates you for your condition.
 Finalists: ANZ OnePath Trauma Comprehensive; AIA Vitality Priority Protection Crisis Recovery
BEST INCOME PROTECTION POLICY WINNER: TAL Accelerated Income Protection Premier
What the Rice Warner judges said: " TAL's policy offers a strong balance of features and price backed up by a solid financial institution. In particular it offers excellent pricing across a wide spectrum of occupations, benefits, waiting periods and ages."
Debilitating illness or injury are too dreadful to ponder. That's the view of most Australians, who hope for the best and save on insurance cover they "don't need". But 25 per cent of Australians will be disabled for more than three months during their working life, says insurer TAL, which took the top honour for income protection cover.
The judges highlighted its excellent total and partial disability definition, along with the product being well targeted to workers' broad spectrum of needs. Adequate income cover provides more than just a cheque at claim time, says Gavin Teichner, TAL's general manager, individual life. "Income Protection Premier has a range of benefits included to help rehabilitate through illness or injury and also offers critical illness cover on their [customers'] own children at no extra cost."
In the past five years, the insurer has paid almost $370 million in income protection claims and Income Protection Premier has the option to cover additional critical illness events, payable as an extra lump sum.
"Our ability to earn an income is one of our biggest assets and we must protect it," Teichner says. "A big misconception around income protection is that it's too expensive … but there are ways to address affordability issues, such as setting it up through superannuation – and it's actually tax deductible."
Finalists: ANZ OnePath OneCare Income Secure Comprehensive; BT Protection Plan Income Protection Plus
BEST TERM/TPD POLICY WINNER: AIA Vitality Priority Protection Life Cover TPD
What the Rice Warner judges said: "An excellent score for a sharp price and excellent features backed by a strong financial institution."
It is the families of the insured who can tell you why life and total and permanent disability cover is so important, because the person who listened to sage advice at one point in his or her life and took out a policy most likely will not be able to convince you.
The random events that may spell financial doom are deflected when robust insurance is in place.
The judges placed AIA Australia at the top for its pricing across occupations and ages, and noted its flexibility regarding definitions. The comprehensive list of benefits and options was also noted and the Vitality initiative, which reduces premiums and adds benefits for policyholders who make healthy choices, was also singled out.
Finalists: MLC Insurance Life Cover/TPD Rider; AMP Elevate Insurance Life/TPD Rider
